Author: Alexander, Caroline
Title: The war that killed Achilles: the true story of Homer's Iliad and the Trojan War
Abstract Note: Many have forgotten that the subject of the "Illiad" was war--not merely the poetical romance of the war at Troy, but war, in all its enduring devastation. This groundbreaking reading of Homer's epic poem restores the poet's vision of the tragedy of war, addressing many of the central questions that define the war experience of every age

Author: Allen-Hornblower, Emily
Title: From agent to spectator: witnessing the aftermath in ancient Greek epic and tragedy
Abstract Note: "We tend to associate the act of witnessing with bystanders who have not played an active role in the events that they are watching. The present monograph considers characters from Homer's Iliad and Greek tragedy that are looking on and reacting (in word, deed, or both) to their own actions. It closely examines those scenes in which they are put in the position of a spectator, witnessing the aftermath of their deed(s)"--Provided by publisher
